function three.js.Vector2.prototype.fromArray ( array, offset )

  • description and source-code
    fromArray = function ( array, offset ) {

		if ( offset === undefined ) offset = 0;

		this.x = array[ offset ];
		this.y = array[ offset + 1 ];

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.fromAttribute ( attribute, index, offset )

  • description and source-code
    fromAttribute = function ( attribute, index, offset ) {

		if ( offset === undefined ) offset = 0;

		index = index * attribute.itemSize + offset;

		this.x = attribute.array[ index ];
		this.y = attribute.array[ index + 1 ];

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.getComponent ( index )

  • description and source-code
    getComponent = function ( index ) {

		switch ( index ) {

			case 0: return this.x;
			case 1: return this.y;
			default: throw new Error( 'index is out of range: ' + index );

		}

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.length ()

  • description and source-code
    length = function () {

		return Math.sqrt( this.x * this.x + this.y * this.y );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.lengthManhattan ()

  • description and source-code
    lengthManhattan = function () {

		return Math.abs( this.x ) + Math.abs( this.y );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.lengthSq ()

  • description and source-code
    lengthSq = function () {

		return this.x * this.x + this.y * this.y;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.lerp ( v, alpha )

  • description and source-code
    lerp = function ( v, alpha ) {

		this.x += ( v.x - this.x ) * alpha;
		this.y += ( v.y - this.y ) * alpha;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.lerpVectors ( v1, v2, alpha )

  • description and source-code
    lerpVectors = function ( v1, v2, alpha ) {

		return this.subVectors( v2, v1 ).multiplyScalar( alpha ).add( v1 );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.max ( v )

  • description and source-code
    max = function ( v ) {

		this.x = Math.max( this.x, v.x );
		this.y = Math.max( this.y, v.y );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.min ( v )

  • description and source-code
    min = function ( v ) {

		this.x = Math.min( this.x, v.x );
		this.y = Math.min( this.y, v.y );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.multiply ( v )

  • description and source-code
    multiply = function ( v ) {

		this.x *= v.x;
		this.y *= v.y;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.multiplyScalar ( scalar )

  • description and source-code
    multiplyScalar = function ( scalar ) {

		if ( isFinite( scalar ) ) {

			this.x *= scalar;
			this.y *= scalar;

		} else {

			this.x = 0;
			this.y = 0;

		}

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.negate ()

  • description and source-code
    negate = function () {

		this.x = - this.x;
		this.y = - this.y;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.normalize ()

  • description and source-code
    normalize = function () {

		return this.divideScalar( this.length() );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.rotateAround ( center, angle )

  • description and source-code
    rotateAround = function ( center, angle ) {

		var c = Math.cos( angle ), s = Math.sin( angle );

		var x = this.x - center.x;
		var y = this.y - center.y;

		this.x = x * c - y * s + center.x;
		this.y = x * s + y * c + center.y;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.round ()

  • description and source-code
    round = function () {

		this.x = Math.round( this.x );
		this.y = Math.round( this.y );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.roundToZero ()

  • description and source-code
    roundToZero = function () {

		this.x = ( this.x < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.x ) : Math.floor( this.x );
		this.y = ( this.y < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.y ) : Math.floor( this.y );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.set ( x, y )

  • description and source-code
    set = function ( x, y ) {

		this.x = x;
		this.y = y;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.setComponent ( index, value )

  • description and source-code
    setComponent = function ( index, value ) {

		switch ( index ) {

			case 0: this.x = value; break;
			case 1: this.y = value; break;
			default: throw new Error( 'index is out of range: ' + index );

		}

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.setLength ( length )

  • description and source-code
    setLength = function ( length ) {

		return this.multiplyScalar( length / this.length() );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.setScalar ( scalar )

  • description and source-code
    setScalar = function ( scalar ) {

		this.x = scalar;
		this.y = scalar;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.setX ( x )

  • description and source-code
    setX = function ( x ) {

		this.x = x;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.setY ( y )

  • description and source-code
    setY = function ( y ) {

		this.y = y;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.sub ( v, w )

  • description and source-code
    sub = function ( v, w ) {

		if ( w !== undefined ) {

			console.warn( 'THREE.Vector2: .sub() now only accepts one argument. Use .subVectors( a, b ) instead.' );
			return this.subVectors( v, w );

		}

		this.x -= v.x;
		this.y -= v.y;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.subScalar ( s )

  • description and source-code
    subScalar = function ( s ) {

		this.x -= s;
		this.y -= s;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.subVectors ( a, b )

  • description and source-code
    subVectors = function ( a, b ) {

		this.x = a.x - b.x;
		this.y = a.y - b.y;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector2.prototype.toArray ( array, offset )

  • description and source-code
    toArray = function ( array, offset ) {

		if ( array === undefined ) array = [];
		if ( offset === undefined ) offset = 0;

		array[ offset ] = this.x;
		array[ offset + 1 ] = this.y;

		return array;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.js.Vector3

function three.js.Vector3 ( x, y, z )

  • description and source-code
    Vector3 = function ( x, y, z ) {

	this.x = x || 0;
	this.y = y || 0;
	this.z = z || 0;

}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.js.Vector3.prototype

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.add ( v, w )

  • description and source-code
    add = function ( v, w ) {

		if ( w !== undefined ) {

			console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: .add() now only accepts one argument. Use .addVectors( a, b ) instead.' );
			return this.addVectors( v, w );

		}

		this.x += v.x;
		this.y += v.y;
		this.z += v.z;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.addScalar ( s )

  • description and source-code
    addScalar = function ( s ) {

		this.x += s;
		this.y += s;
		this.z += s;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.addScaledVector ( v, s )

  • description and source-code
    addScaledVector = function ( v, s ) {

		this.x += v.x * s;
		this.y += v.y * s;
		this.z += v.z * s;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.addVectors ( a, b )

  • description and source-code
    addVectors = function ( a, b ) {

		this.x = a.x + b.x;
		this.y = a.y + b.y;
		this.z = a.z + b.z;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.angleTo ( v )

  • description and source-code
    angleTo = function ( v ) {

		var theta = this.dot( v ) / ( Math.sqrt( this.lengthSq() * v.lengthSq() ) );

		// clamp, to handle numerical problems

		return Math.acos( THREE.Math.clamp( theta, - 1, 1 ) );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.applyAxisAngle ( axis, angle )

  • description and source-code
    function applyAxisAngle( axis, angle ) {

			if ( quaternion === undefined ) quaternion = new THREE.Quaternion();

			return this.applyQuaternion( quaternion.setFromAxisAngle( axis, angle ) );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.applyEuler ( euler )

  • description and source-code
    function applyEuler( euler ) {

			if ( euler instanceof THREE.Euler === false ) {

				console.error( 'THREE.Vector3: .applyEuler() now expects an Euler rotation rather than a Vector3 and order.' );

			}

			if ( quaternion === undefined ) quaternion = new THREE.Quaternion();

			return this.applyQuaternion( quaternion.setFromEuler( euler ) );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.applyMatrix3 ( m )

  • description and source-code
    applyMatrix3 = function ( m ) {

		var x = this.x, y = this.y, z = this.z;
		var e = m.elements;

		this.x = e[ 0 ] * x + e[ 3 ] * y + e[ 6 ] * z;
		this.y = e[ 1 ] * x + e[ 4 ] * y + e[ 7 ] * z;
		this.z = e[ 2 ] * x + e[ 5 ] * y + e[ 8 ] * z;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.applyMatrix4 ( m )

  • description and source-code
    applyMatrix4 = function ( m ) {

		// input: THREE.Matrix4 affine matrix

		var x = this.x, y = this.y, z = this.z;
		var e = m.elements;

		this.x = e[ 0 ] * x + e[ 4 ] * y + e[ 8 ]  * z + e[ 12 ];
		this.y = e[ 1 ] * x + e[ 5 ] * y + e[ 9 ]  * z + e[ 13 ];
		this.z = e[ 2 ] * x + e[ 6 ] * y + e[ 10 ] * z + e[ 14 ];

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.applyProjection ( m )

  • description and source-code
    applyProjection = function ( m ) {

		// input: THREE.Matrix4 projection matrix

		var x = this.x, y = this.y, z = this.z;
		var e = m.elements;
		var d = 1 / ( e[ 3 ] * x + e[ 7 ] * y + e[ 11 ] * z + e[ 15 ] ); // perspective divide

		this.x = ( e[ 0 ] * x + e[ 4 ] * y + e[ 8 ]  * z + e[ 12 ] ) * d;
		this.y = ( e[ 1 ] * x + e[ 5 ] * y + e[ 9 ]  * z + e[ 13 ] ) * d;
		this.z = ( e[ 2 ] * x + e[ 6 ] * y + e[ 10 ] * z + e[ 14 ] ) * d;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.applyQuaternion ( q )

  • description and source-code
    applyQuaternion = function ( q ) {

		var x = this.x, y = this.y, z = this.z;
		var qx = q.x, qy = q.y, qz = q.z, qw = q.w;

		// calculate quat * vector

		var ix =  qw * x + qy * z - qz * y;
		var iy =  qw * y + qz * x - qx * z;
		var iz =  qw * z + qx * y - qy * x;
		var iw = - qx * x - qy * y - qz * z;

		// calculate result * inverse quat

		this.x = ix * qw + iw * - qx + iy * - qz - iz * - qy;
		this.y = iy * qw + iw * - qy + iz * - qx - ix * - qz;
		this.z = iz * qw + iw * - qz + ix * - qy - iy * - qx;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.ceil ()

  • description and source-code
    ceil = function () {

		this.x = Math.ceil( this.x );
		this.y = Math.ceil( this.y );
		this.z = Math.ceil( this.z );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.clamp ( min, max )

  • description and source-code
    clamp = function ( min, max ) {

		// This function assumes min < max, if this assumption isn't true it will not operate correctly

		this.x = Math.max( min.x, Math.min( max.x, this.x ) );
		this.y = Math.max( min.y, Math.min( max.y, this.y ) );
		this.z = Math.max( min.z, Math.min( max.z, this.z ) );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.clampLength ( min, max )

  • description and source-code
    clampLength = function ( min, max ) {

		var length = this.length();

		return this.multiplyScalar( Math.max( min, Math.min( max, length ) ) / length );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.clampScalar ( minVal, maxVal )

  • description and source-code
    function clampScalar( minVal, maxVal ) {

			if ( min === undefined ) {

				min = new THREE.Vector3();
				max = new THREE.Vector3();

			}

			min.set( minVal, minVal, minVal );
			max.set( maxVal, maxVal, maxVal );

			return this.clamp( min, max );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.clone ()

  • description and source-code
    clone = function () {

		return new this.constructor( this.x, this.y, this.z );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.constructor ( x, y, z )

  • description and source-code
    constructor = function ( x, y, z ) {

	this.x = x || 0;
	this.y = y || 0;
	this.z = z || 0;

}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.copy ( v )

  • description and source-code
    copy = function ( v ) {

		this.x = v.x;
		this.y = v.y;
		this.z = v.z;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.cross ( v, w )

  • description and source-code
    cross = function ( v, w ) {

		if ( w !== undefined ) {

			console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: .cross() now only accepts one argument. Use .crossVectors( a, b ) instead.' );
			return this.crossVectors( v, w );

		}

		var x = this.x, y = this.y, z = this.z;

		this.x = y * v.z - z * v.y;
		this.y = z * v.x - x * v.z;
		this.z = x * v.y - y * v.x;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.crossVectors ( a, b )

  • description and source-code
    crossVectors = function ( a, b ) {

		var ax = a.x, ay = a.y, az = a.z;
		var bx = b.x, by = b.y, bz = b.z;

		this.x = ay * bz - az * by;
		this.y = az * bx - ax * bz;
		this.z = ax * by - ay * bx;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.distanceTo ( v )

  • description and source-code
    distanceTo = function ( v ) {

		return Math.sqrt( this.distanceToSquared( v ) );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.distanceToSquared ( v )

  • description and source-code
    distanceToSquared = function ( v ) {

		var dx = this.x - v.x, dy = this.y - v.y, dz = this.z - v.z;

		return dx * dx + dy * dy + dz * dz;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.divide ( v )

  • description and source-code
    divide = function ( v ) {

		this.x /= v.x;
		this.y /= v.y;
		this.z /= v.z;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.divideScalar ( scalar )

  • description and source-code
    divideScalar = function ( scalar ) {

		return this.multiplyScalar( 1 / scalar );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.dot ( v )

  • description and source-code
    dot = function ( v ) {

		return this.x * v.x + this.y * v.y + this.z * v.z;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.equals ( v )

  • description and source-code
    equals = function ( v ) {

		return ( ( v.x === this.x ) && ( v.y === this.y ) && ( v.z === this.z ) );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.floor ()

  • description and source-code
    floor = function () {

		this.x = Math.floor( this.x );
		this.y = Math.floor( this.y );
		this.z = Math.floor( this.z );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.fromArray ( array, offset )

  • description and source-code
    fromArray = function ( array, offset ) {

		if ( offset === undefined ) offset = 0;

		this.x = array[ offset ];
		this.y = array[ offset + 1 ];
		this.z = array[ offset + 2 ];

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.fromAttribute ( attribute, index, offset )

  • description and source-code
    fromAttribute = function ( attribute, index, offset ) {

		if ( offset === undefined ) offset = 0;

		index = index * attribute.itemSize + offset;

		this.x = attribute.array[ index ];
		this.y = attribute.array[ index + 1 ];
		this.z = attribute.array[ index + 2 ];

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.getColumnFromMatrix ( index, matrix )

  • description and source-code
    getColumnFromMatrix = function ( index, matrix ) {
		console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: .getColumnFromMatrix() has been renamed to .setFromMatrixColumn().' );
		return this.setFromMatrixColumn( matrix, index );
	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.getComponent ( index )

  • description and source-code
    getComponent = function ( index ) {

		switch ( index ) {

			case 0: return this.x;
			case 1: return this.y;
			case 2: return this.z;
			default: throw new Error( 'index is out of range: ' + index );

		}

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.getPositionFromMatrix ( m )

  • description and source-code
    getPositionFromMatrix = function ( m ) {
		console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: .getPositionFromMatrix() has been renamed to .setFromMatrixPosition().' );
		return this.setFromMatrixPosition( m );
	}
  • example usage

    getScaleFromMatrix = function ( m ) {
		console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: .getScaleFromMatrix() has been renamed to .setFromMatrixScale().' );
		return this.setFromMatrixScale( m );
	}
  • example usage

    length = function () {

		return Math.sqrt( this.x * this.x + this.y * this.y + this.z * this.z );

	}
  • example usage

		return Math.abs( this.x ) + Math.abs( this.y ) + Math.abs( this.z );

	}

    lengthSq = function () {

		return this.x * this.x + this.y * this.y + this.z * this.z;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.lerp ( v, alpha )

  • description and source-code
    lerp = function ( v, alpha ) {

		this.x += ( v.x - this.x ) * alpha;
		this.y += ( v.y - this.y ) * alpha;
		this.z += ( v.z - this.z ) * alpha;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.lerpVectors ( v1, v2, alpha )

  • description and source-code
    lerpVectors = function ( v1, v2, alpha ) {

		return this.subVectors( v2, v1 ).multiplyScalar( alpha ).add( v1 );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.max ( v )

  • description and source-code
    max = function ( v ) {

		this.x = Math.max( this.x, v.x );
		this.y = Math.max( this.y, v.y );
		this.z = Math.max( this.z, v.z );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.min ( v )

  • description and source-code
    min = function ( v ) {

		this.x = Math.min( this.x, v.x );
		this.y = Math.min( this.y, v.y );
		this.z = Math.min( this.z, v.z );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.multiply ( v, w )

  • description and source-code
    multiply = function ( v, w ) {

		if ( w !== undefined ) {

			console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: .multiply() now only accepts one argument. Use .multiplyVectors( a, b ) instead.' );
			return this.multiplyVectors( v, w );

		}

		this.x *= v.x;
		this.y *= v.y;
		this.z *= v.z;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.multiplyScalar ( scalar )

  • description and source-code
    multiplyScalar = function ( scalar ) {

		if ( isFinite( scalar ) ) {

			this.x *= scalar;
			this.y *= scalar;
			this.z *= scalar;

		} else {

			this.x = 0;
			this.y = 0;
			this.z = 0;

		}

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.multiplyVectors ( a, b )

  • description and source-code
    multiplyVectors = function ( a, b ) {

		this.x = a.x * b.x;
		this.y = a.y * b.y;
		this.z = a.z * b.z;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.negate ()

  • description and source-code
    negate = function () {

		this.x = - this.x;
		this.y = - this.y;
		this.z = - this.z;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.normalize ()

  • description and source-code
    normalize = function () {

		return this.divideScalar( this.length() );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.project ( camera )

  • description and source-code
    function project( camera ) {

			if ( matrix === undefined ) matrix = new THREE.Matrix4();

			matrix.multiplyMatrices( camera.projectionMatrix, matrix.getInverse( camera.matrixWorld ) );
			return this.applyProjection( matrix );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.projectOnPlane ( planeNormal )

  • description and source-code
    function projectOnPlane( planeNormal ) {

			if ( v1 === undefined ) v1 = new THREE.Vector3();

			v1.copy( this ).projectOnVector( planeNormal );

			return this.sub( v1 );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.projectOnVector ( vector )

  • description and source-code
    function projectOnVector( vector ) {

			if ( v1 === undefined ) v1 = new THREE.Vector3();

			v1.copy( vector ).normalize();

			dot = this.dot( v1 );

			return this.copy( v1 ).multiplyScalar( dot );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.reflect ( normal )

  • description and source-code
    function reflect( normal ) {

			if ( v1 === undefined ) v1 = new THREE.Vector3();

			return this.sub( v1.copy( normal ).multiplyScalar( 2 * this.dot( normal ) ) );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.round ()

  • description and source-code
    round = function () {

		this.x = Math.round( this.x );
		this.y = Math.round( this.y );
		this.z = Math.round( this.z );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.roundToZero ()

  • description and source-code
    roundToZero = function () {

		this.x = ( this.x < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.x ) : Math.floor( this.x );
		this.y = ( this.y < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.y ) : Math.floor( this.y );
		this.z = ( this.z < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.z ) : Math.floor( this.z );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.set ( x, y, z )

  • description and source-code
    set = function ( x, y, z ) {

		this.x = x;
		this.y = y;
		this.z = z;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.setComponent ( index, value )

  • description and source-code
    setComponent = function ( index, value ) {

		switch ( index ) {

			case 0: this.x = value; break;
			case 1: this.y = value; break;
			case 2: this.z = value; break;
			default: throw new Error( 'index is out of range: ' + index );

		}

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.setEulerFromQuaternion ()

  • description and source-code
    setEulerFromQuaternion = function () {
		console.error( 'THREE.Vector3: .setEulerFromQuaternion() has been removed. Use Euler.setFromQuaternion() instead.' );
	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.setEulerFromRotationMatrix ()

  • description and source-code
    setEulerFromRotationMatrix = function () {
		console.error( 'THREE.Vector3: .setEulerFromRotationMatrix() has been removed. Use Euler.setFromRotationMatrix() instead.' );
	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.setFromMatrixColumn ( m, index )

  • description and source-code
    setFromMatrixColumn = function ( m, index ) {

		if ( typeof m === 'number' ) {

			console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: setFromMatrixColumn now expects ( matrix, index ).' );
			var temp = m
			m = index;
			index = temp;

		}

		return this.fromArray( m.elements, index * 4 );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.setFromMatrixPosition ( m )

  • description and source-code
    setFromMatrixPosition = function ( m ) {

		return this.setFromMatrixColumn( m, 3 );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.setFromMatrixScale ( m )

  • description and source-code
    setFromMatrixScale = function ( m ) {

		var sx = this.setFromMatrixColumn( m, 0 ).length();
		var sy = this.setFromMatrixColumn( m, 1 ).length();
		var sz = this.setFromMatrixColumn( m, 2 ).length();

		this.x = sx;
		this.y = sy;
		this.z = sz;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.setFromSpherical ( s )

  • description and source-code
    setFromSpherical = function ( s ) {

		var sinPhiRadius = Math.sin( s.phi ) * s.radius;

		this.x = sinPhiRadius * Math.sin( s.theta );
		this.y = Math.cos( s.phi ) * s.radius;
		this.z = sinPhiRadius * Math.cos( s.theta );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.setLength ( length )

  • description and source-code
    setLength = function ( length ) {

		return this.multiplyScalar( length / this.length() );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

		return this;

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.sub ( v, w )

  • description and source-code
    sub = function ( v, w ) {

		if ( w !== undefined ) {

			console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: .sub() now only accepts one argument. Use .subVectors( a, b ) instead.' );
			return this.subVectors( v, w );

		}

		this.x -= v.x;
		this.y -= v.y;
		this.z -= v.z;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.subScalar ( s )

  • description and source-code
    subScalar = function ( s ) {

		this.x -= s;
		this.y -= s;
		this.z -= s;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.subVectors ( a, b )

  • description and source-code
    subVectors = function ( a, b ) {

		this.x = a.x - b.x;
		this.y = a.y - b.y;
		this.z = a.z - b.z;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.toArray ( array, offset )

  • description and source-code
    toArray = function ( array, offset ) {

		if ( array === undefined ) array = [];
		if ( offset === undefined ) offset = 0;

		array[ offset ] = this.x;
		array[ offset + 1 ] = this.y;
		array[ offset + 2 ] = this.z;

		return array;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.transformDirection ( m )

  • description and source-code
    transformDirection = function ( m ) {

		// input: THREE.Matrix4 affine matrix
		// vector interpreted as a direction

		var x = this.x, y = this.y, z = this.z;
		var e = m.elements;

		this.x = e[ 0 ] * x + e[ 4 ] * y + e[ 8 ]  * z;
		this.y = e[ 1 ] * x + e[ 5 ] * y + e[ 9 ]  * z;
		this.z = e[ 2 ] * x + e[ 6 ] * y + e[ 10 ] * z;

		return this.normalize();

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector3.prototype.unproject ( camera )

  • description and source-code
    function unproject( camera ) {

			if ( matrix === undefined ) matrix = new THREE.Matrix4();

			matrix.multiplyMatrices( camera.matrixWorld, matrix.getInverse( camera.projectionMatrix ) );
			return this.applyProjection( matrix );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.js.Vector4

function three.js.Vector4 ( x, y, z, w )

  • description and source-code
    Vector4 = function ( x, y, z, w ) {

	this.x = x || 0;
	this.y = y || 0;
	this.z = z || 0;
	this.w = ( w !== undefined ) ? w : 1;

}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.js.Vector4.prototype

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.add ( v, w )

  • description and source-code
    add = function ( v, w ) {

		if ( w !== undefined ) {

			console.warn( 'THREE.Vector4: .add() now only accepts one argument. Use .addVectors( a, b ) instead.' );
			return this.addVectors( v, w );

		}

		this.x += v.x;
		this.y += v.y;
		this.z += v.z;
		this.w += v.w;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.addScalar ( s )

  • description and source-code
    addScalar = function ( s ) {

		this.x += s;
		this.y += s;
		this.z += s;
		this.w += s;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.addScaledVector ( v, s )

  • description and source-code
    addScaledVector = function ( v, s ) {

		this.x += v.x * s;
		this.y += v.y * s;
		this.z += v.z * s;
		this.w += v.w * s;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.addVectors ( a, b )

  • description and source-code
    addVectors = function ( a, b ) {

		this.x = a.x + b.x;
		this.y = a.y + b.y;
		this.z = a.z + b.z;
		this.w = a.w + b.w;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.applyMatrix4 ( m )

  • description and source-code
    applyMatrix4 = function ( m ) {

		var x = this.x, y = this.y, z = this.z, w = this.w;
		var e = m.elements;

		this.x = e[ 0 ] * x + e[ 4 ] * y + e[ 8 ] * z + e[ 12 ] * w;
		this.y = e[ 1 ] * x + e[ 5 ] * y + e[ 9 ] * z + e[ 13 ] * w;
		this.z = e[ 2 ] * x + e[ 6 ] * y + e[ 10 ] * z + e[ 14 ] * w;
		this.w = e[ 3 ] * x + e[ 7 ] * y + e[ 11 ] * z + e[ 15 ] * w;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.ceil ()

  • description and source-code
    ceil = function () {

		this.x = Math.ceil( this.x );
		this.y = Math.ceil( this.y );
		this.z = Math.ceil( this.z );
		this.w = Math.ceil( this.w );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.clamp ( min, max )

  • description and source-code
    clamp = function ( min, max ) {

		// This function assumes min < max, if this assumption isn't true it will not operate correctly

		this.x = Math.max( min.x, Math.min( max.x, this.x ) );
		this.y = Math.max( min.y, Math.min( max.y, this.y ) );
		this.z = Math.max( min.z, Math.min( max.z, this.z ) );
		this.w = Math.max( min.w, Math.min( max.w, this.w ) );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.clampScalar ( minVal, maxVal )

  • description and source-code
    function clampScalar( minVal, maxVal ) {

			if ( min === undefined ) {

				min = new THREE.Vector4();
				max = new THREE.Vector4();

			}

			min.set( minVal, minVal, minVal, minVal );
			max.set( maxVal, maxVal, maxVal, maxVal );

			return this.clamp( min, max );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.clone ()

  • description and source-code
    clone = function () {

		return new this.constructor( this.x, this.y, this.z, this.w );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.constructor ( x, y, z, w )

  • description and source-code
    constructor = function ( x, y, z, w ) {

	this.x = x || 0;
	this.y = y || 0;
	this.z = z || 0;
	this.w = ( w !== undefined ) ? w : 1;

}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.copy ( v )

  • description and source-code
    copy = function ( v ) {

		this.x = v.x;
		this.y = v.y;
		this.z = v.z;
		this.w = ( v.w !== undefined ) ? v.w : 1;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.divideScalar ( scalar )

  • description and source-code
    divideScalar = function ( scalar ) {

		return this.multiplyScalar( 1 / scalar );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.dot ( v )

  • description and source-code
    dot = function ( v ) {

		return this.x * v.x + this.y * v.y + this.z * v.z + this.w * v.w;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.equals ( v )

  • description and source-code
    equals = function ( v ) {

		return ( ( v.x === this.x ) && ( v.y === this.y ) && ( v.z === this.z ) && ( v.w === this.w ) );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.floor ()

  • description and source-code
    floor = function () {

		this.x = Math.floor( this.x );
		this.y = Math.floor( this.y );
		this.z = Math.floor( this.z );
		this.w = Math.floor( this.w );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.fromArray ( array, offset )

  • description and source-code
    fromArray = function ( array, offset ) {

		if ( offset === undefined ) offset = 0;

		this.x = array[ offset ];
		this.y = array[ offset + 1 ];
		this.z = array[ offset + 2 ];
		this.w = array[ offset + 3 ];

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.fromAttribute ( attribute, index, offset )

  • description and source-code
    fromAttribute = function ( attribute, index, offset ) {

		if ( offset === undefined ) offset = 0;

		index = index * attribute.itemSize + offset;

		this.x = attribute.array[ index ];
		this.y = attribute.array[ index + 1 ];
		this.z = attribute.array[ index + 2 ];
		this.w = attribute.array[ index + 3 ];

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.getComponent ( index )

  • description and source-code
    getComponent = function ( index ) {

		switch ( index ) {

			case 0: return this.x;
			case 1: return this.y;
			case 2: return this.z;
			case 3: return this.w;
			default: throw new Error( 'index is out of range: ' + index );

		}

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.length ()

  • description and source-code
    length = function () {

		return Math.sqrt( this.x * this.x + this.y * this.y + this.z * this.z + this.w * this.w );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.lengthManhattan ()

  • description and source-code
    lengthManhattan = function () {

		return Math.abs( this.x ) + Math.abs( this.y ) + Math.abs( this.z ) + Math.abs( this.w );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.lengthSq ()

  • description and source-code
    lengthSq = function () {

		return this.x * this.x + this.y * this.y + this.z * this.z + this.w * this.w;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.lerp ( v, alpha )

  • description and source-code
    lerp = function ( v, alpha ) {

		this.x += ( v.x - this.x ) * alpha;
		this.y += ( v.y - this.y ) * alpha;
		this.z += ( v.z - this.z ) * alpha;
		this.w += ( v.w - this.w ) * alpha;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.lerpVectors ( v1, v2, alpha )

  • description and source-code
    lerpVectors = function ( v1, v2, alpha ) {

		return this.subVectors( v2, v1 ).multiplyScalar( alpha ).add( v1 );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.max ( v )

  • description and source-code
    max = function ( v ) {

		this.x = Math.max( this.x, v.x );
		this.y = Math.max( this.y, v.y );
		this.z = Math.max( this.z, v.z );
		this.w = Math.max( this.w, v.w );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.min ( v )

  • description and source-code
    min = function ( v ) {

		this.x = Math.min( this.x, v.x );
		this.y = Math.min( this.y, v.y );
		this.z = Math.min( this.z, v.z );
		this.w = Math.min( this.w, v.w );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.multiplyScalar ( scalar )

  • description and source-code
    multiplyScalar = function ( scalar ) {

		if ( isFinite( scalar ) ) {

			this.x *= scalar;
			this.y *= scalar;
			this.z *= scalar;
			this.w *= scalar;

		} else {

			this.x = 0;
			this.y = 0;
			this.z = 0;
			this.w = 0;

		}

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.negate ()

  • description and source-code
    negate = function () {

		this.x = - this.x;
		this.y = - this.y;
		this.z = - this.z;
		this.w = - this.w;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.normalize ()

  • description and source-code
    normalize = function () {

		return this.divideScalar( this.length() );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.round ()

  • description and source-code
    round = function () {

		this.x = Math.round( this.x );
		this.y = Math.round( this.y );
		this.z = Math.round( this.z );
		this.w = Math.round( this.w );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.roundToZero ()

  • description and source-code
    roundToZero = function () {

		this.x = ( this.x < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.x ) : Math.floor( this.x );
		this.y = ( this.y < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.y ) : Math.floor( this.y );
		this.z = ( this.z < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.z ) : Math.floor( this.z );
		this.w = ( this.w < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.w ) : Math.floor( this.w );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.set ( x, y, z, w )

  • description and source-code
    set = function ( x, y, z, w ) {

		this.x = x;
		this.y = y;
		this.z = z;
		this.w = w;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.setAxisAngleFromQuaternion ( q )

  • description and source-code
    setAxisAngleFromQuaternion = function ( q ) {

		// http://www.euclideanspace.com/maths/geometry/rotations/conversions/quaternionToAngle/index.htm

		// q is assumed to be normalized

		this.w = 2 * Math.acos( q.w );

		var s = Math.sqrt( 1 - q.w * q.w );

		if ( s < 0.0001 ) {

			 this.x = 1;
			 this.y = 0;
			 this.z = 0;

		} else {

			 this.x = q.x / s;
			 this.y = q.y / s;
			 this.z = q.z / s;

		}

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.setAxisAngleFromRotationMatrix ( m )

  • description and source-code
    setAxisAngleFromRotationMatrix = function ( m ) {

		// http://www.euclideanspace.com/maths/geometry/rotations/conversions/matrixToAngle/index.htm

		// assumes the upper 3x3 of m is a pure rotation matrix (i.e, unscaled)

		var angle, x, y, z,		// variables for result
			epsilon = 0.01,		// margin to allow for rounding errors
			epsilon2 = 0.1,		// margin to distinguish between 0 and 180 degrees

			te = m.elements,

			m11 = te[ 0 ], m12 = te[ 4 ], m13 = te[ 8 ],
			m21 = te[ 1 ], m22 = te[ 5 ], m23 = te[ 9 ],
			m31 = te[ 2 ], m32 = te[ 6 ], m33 = te[ 10 ];

		if ( ( Math.abs( m12 - m21 ) < epsilon ) &&
		     ( Math.abs( m13 - m31 ) < epsilon ) &&
		     ( Math.abs( m23 - m32 ) < epsilon ) ) {

			// singularity found
			// first check for identity matrix which must have +1 for all terms
			// in leading diagonal and zero in other terms

			if ( ( Math.abs( m12 + m21 ) < epsilon2 ) &&
			     ( Math.abs( m13 + m31 ) < epsilon2 ) &&
			     ( Math.abs( m23 + m32 ) < epsilon2 ) &&
			     ( Math.abs( m11 + m22 + m33 - 3 ) < epsilon2 ) ) {

				// this singularity is identity matrix so angle = 0

				this.set( 1, 0, 0, 0 );

				return this; // zero angle, arbitrary axis

			}

			// otherwise this singularity is angle = 180

			angle = Math.PI;

			var xx = ( m11 + 1 ) / 2;
			var yy = ( m22 + 1 ) / 2;
			var zz = ( m33 + 1 ) / 2;
			var xy = ( m12 + m21 ) / 4;
			var xz = ( m13 + m31 ) / 4;
			var yz = ( m23 + m32 ) / 4;

			if ( ( xx > yy ) && ( xx > zz ) ) {

				// m11 is the largest diagonal term

				if ( xx < epsilon ) {

					x = 0;
					y = 0.707106781;
					z = 0.707106781;

				} else {

					x = Math.sqrt( xx );
					y = xy / x;
					z = xz / x;

				}

			} else if ( yy > zz ) {

				// m22 is the largest diagonal term

				if ( yy < epsilon ) {

					x = 0.707106781;
					y = 0;
					z = 0.707106781;

				} else {

					y = Math.sqrt( yy );
					x = xy / y;
					z = yz / y;

				}

			} else {

				// m33 is the largest diagonal term so base result on this

				if ( zz < epsilon ) {

					x = 0.707106781;
					y = 0.707106781;
					z = 0;

				} else {

					z = Math.sqrt( zz );
					x = xz / z;
					y = yz / z;

				}

			}

			this.set( x, y, z, angle );

			return this; // return 180 deg rotation

		}

		// as we have reached here there are no singularities so we can handle normally

		var s = Math.sqrt( ( m32 - m23 ) * ( m32 - m23 ) +
		                   ( m13 - m31 ) * ( m13 - m31 ) +
		                   ( m21 - m12 ) * ( m21 - m12 ) ); // used to normalize

		if ( Math.abs( s ) < 0.001 ) s = 1;

		// prevent divide by zero, should not happen if matrix is orthogonal and should be
		// caught by singularity test above, but I've left it in just in case

		this.x = ( m32 - m23 ) / s;
		this.y = ( m13 - m31 ) / s;
		this.z = ( m21 - m12 ) / s;
		this.w = Math.acos( ( m11 + m22 + m33 - 1 ) / 2 );

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.setComponent ( index, value )

  • description and source-code
    setComponent = function ( index, value ) {

		switch ( index ) {

			case 0: this.x = value; break;
			case 1: this.y = value; break;
			case 2: this.z = value; break;
			case 3: this.w = value; break;
			default: throw new Error( 'index is out of range: ' + index );

		}

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.setLength ( length )

  • description and source-code
    setLength = function ( length ) {

		return this.multiplyScalar( length / this.length() );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

    setScalar = function ( scalar ) {

		this.x = scalar;
		this.y = scalar;
		this.z = scalar;
		this.w = scalar;

		return this;

	}

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.sub ( v, w )

  • description and source-code
    sub = function ( v, w ) {

		if ( w !== undefined ) {

			console.warn( 'THREE.Vector4: .sub() now only accepts one argument. Use .subVectors( a, b ) instead.' );
			return this.subVectors( v, w );

		}

		this.x -= v.x;
		this.y -= v.y;
		this.z -= v.z;
		this.w -= v.w;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.subScalar ( s )

  • description and source-code
    subScalar = function ( s ) {

		this.x -= s;
		this.y -= s;
		this.z -= s;
		this.w -= s;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.subVectors ( a, b )

  • description and source-code
    subVectors = function ( a, b ) {

		this.x = a.x - b.x;
		this.y = a.y - b.y;
		this.z = a.z - b.z;
		this.w = a.w - b.w;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.Vector4.prototype.toArray ( array, offset )

  • description and source-code
    toArray = function ( array, offset ) {

		if ( array === undefined ) array = [];
		if ( offset === undefined ) offset = 0;

		array[ offset ] = this.x;
		array[ offset + 1 ] = this.y;
		array[ offset + 2 ] = this.z;
		array[ offset + 3 ] = this.w;

		return array;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.js.VertexNormalsHelper

function three.js.VertexNormalsHelper ( object, size, hex, linewidth )

  • description and source-code
    VertexNormalsHelper = function ( object, size, hex, linewidth ) {

	this.object = object;

	this.size = ( size !== undefined ) ? size : 1;

	var color = ( hex !== undefined ) ? hex : 0xff0000;

	var width = ( linewidth !== undefined ) ? linewidth : 1;

	//

	var nNormals = 0;

	var objGeometry = this.object.geometry;

	if ( objGeometry instanceof THREE.Geometry ) {

		nNormals = objGeometry.faces.length * 3;

	} else if ( objGeometry instanceof THREE.BufferGeometry ) {

		nNormals = objGeometry.attributes.normal.count;

	}

	//

	var geometry = new THREE.BufferGeometry();

	var positions = new THREE.Float32Attribute( nNormals * 2 * 3, 3 );

	geometry.addAttribute( 'position', positions );

	THREE.LineSegments.call( this, geometry, new THREE.LineBasicMaterial( { color: color, linewidth: width } ) );

	//

	this.matrixAutoUpdate = false;

	this.update();

}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.js.VertexNormalsHelper.prototype

function three.js.VertexNormalsHelper.prototype.constructor ( object, size, hex, linewidth )

  • description and source-code
    constructor = function ( object, size, hex, linewidth ) {

	this.object = object;

	this.size = ( size !== undefined ) ? size : 1;

	var color = ( hex !== undefined ) ? hex : 0xff0000;

	var width = ( linewidth !== undefined ) ? linewidth : 1;

	//

	var nNormals = 0;

	var objGeometry = this.object.geometry;

	if ( objGeometry instanceof THREE.Geometry ) {

		nNormals = objGeometry.faces.length * 3;

	} else if ( objGeometry instanceof THREE.BufferGeometry ) {

		nNormals = objGeometry.attributes.normal.count;

	}

	//

	var geometry = new THREE.BufferGeometry();

	var positions = new THREE.Float32Attribute( nNormals * 2 * 3, 3 );

	geometry.addAttribute( 'position', positions );

	THREE.LineSegments.call( this, geometry, new THREE.LineBasicMaterial( { color: color, linewidth: width } ) );

	//

	this.matrixAutoUpdate = false;

	this.update();

}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.VertexNormalsHelper.prototype.update ()

  • description and source-code
    function update() {

		var keys = [ 'a', 'b', 'c' ];

		this.object.updateMatrixWorld( true );

		normalMatrix.getNormalMatrix( this.object.matrixWorld );

		var matrixWorld = this.object.matrixWorld;

		var position = this.geometry.attributes.position;

		//

		var objGeometry = this.object.geometry;

		if ( objGeometry instanceof THREE.Geometry ) {

			var vertices = objGeometry.vertices;

			var faces = objGeometry.faces;

			var idx = 0;

			for ( var i = 0, l = faces.length; i < l; i ++ ) {

				var face = faces[ i ];

				for ( var j = 0, jl = face.vertexNormals.length; j < jl; j ++ ) {

					var vertex = vertices[ face[ keys[ j ] ] ];

					var normal = face.vertexNormals[ j ];

					v1.copy( vertex ).applyMatrix4( matrixWorld );

					v2.copy( normal ).applyMatrix3( normalMatrix ).normalize().multiplyScalar( this.size ).add( v1 );

					position.setXYZ( idx, v1.x, v1.y, v1.z );

					idx = idx + 1;

					position.setXYZ( idx, v2.x, v2.y, v2.z );

					idx = idx + 1;

				}

			}

		} else if ( objGeometry instanceof THREE.BufferGeometry ) {

			var objPos = objGeometry.attributes.position;

			var objNorm = objGeometry.attributes.normal;

			var idx = 0;

			// for simplicity, ignore index and drawcalls, and render every normal

			for ( var j = 0, jl = objPos.count; j < jl; j ++ ) {

				v1.set( objPos.getX( j ), objPos.getY( j ), objPos.getZ( j ) ).applyMatrix4( matrixWorld );

				v2.set( objNorm.getX( j ), objNorm.getY( j ), objNorm.getZ( j ) );

				v2.applyMatrix3( normalMatrix ).normalize().multiplyScalar( this.size ).add( v1 );

				position.setXYZ( idx, v1.x, v1.y, v1.z );

				idx = idx + 1;

				position.setXYZ( idx, v2.x, v2.y, v2.z );

				idx = idx + 1;

			}

		}

		position.needsUpdate = true;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.js.VideoTexture

function three.js.VideoTexture ( video, mapping, wrapS, wrapT, magFilter, minFilter, format, type, anisotropy )

  • description and source-code
    VideoTexture = function ( video, mapping, wrapS, wrapT, magFilter, minFilter, format, type, anisotropy ) {

	THREE.Texture.call( this, video, mapping, wrapS, wrapT, magFilter, minFilter, format, type, anisotropy );

	this.generateMipmaps = false;

	var scope = this;

	function update() {

		requestAnimationFrame( update );

		if ( video.readyState >= video.HAVE_CURRENT_DATA ) {

			scope.needsUpdate = true;

		}

	}

	update();

}
  • example usage
    n/a

	THREE.Texture.call( this, video, mapping, wrapS, wrapT, magFilter, minFilter, format, type, anisotropy );

	this.generateMipmaps = false;

	var scope = this;

	function update() {

		requestAnimationFrame( update );

		if ( video.readyState >= video.HAVE_CURRENT_DATA ) {

			scope.needsUpdate = true;

		}

	}

	update();

}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.js.WebGLRenderTarget

function three.js.WebGLRenderTarget ( width, height, options )

  • description and source-code
    WebGLRenderTarget = function ( width, height, options ) {

	this.uuid = THREE.Math.generateUUID();

	this.width = width;
	this.height = height;

	this.scissor = new THREE.Vector4( 0, 0, width, height );
	this.scissorTest = false;

	this.viewport = new THREE.Vector4( 0, 0, width, height );

	options = options || {};

	if ( options.minFilter === undefined ) options.minFilter = THREE.LinearFilter;

	this.texture = new THREE.Texture( undefined, undefined, options.wrapS, options.wrapT, options.magFilter, options.minFilter, options
.format, options.type, options.anisotropy, options.encoding );

	this.depthBuffer = options.depthBuffer !== undefined ? options.depthBuffer : true;
	this.stencilBuffer = options.stencilBuffer !== undefined ? options.stencilBuffer : true;
	this.depthTexture = null;

}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.js.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype

function three.js.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.addEventListener ( type, listener )

  • description and source-code
    addEventListener = function ( type, listener ) {

		if ( this._listeners === undefined ) this._listeners = {};

		var listeners = this._listeners;

		if ( listeners[ type ] === undefined ) {

			listeners[ type ] = [];

		}

		if ( listeners[ type ].indexOf( listener ) === - 1 ) {

			listeners[ type ].push( listener );

		}

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.clone ()

  • description and source-code
    clone = function () {

		return new this.constructor().copy( this );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.copy ( source )

  • description and source-code
    copy = function ( source ) {

		this.width = source.width;
		this.height = source.height;

		this.viewport.copy( source.viewport );

		this.texture = source.texture.clone();

		this.depthBuffer = source.depthBuffer;
		this.stencilBuffer = source.stencilBuffer;
		this.depthTexture = source.depthTexture;

		return this;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.dispatchEvent ( event )

  • description and source-code
    dispatchEvent = function ( event ) {

		if ( this._listeners === undefined ) return;

		var listeners = this._listeners;
		var listenerArray = listeners[ event.type ];

		if ( listenerArray !== undefined ) {

			event.target = this;

			var array = [], i = 0;
			var length = listenerArray.length;

			for ( i = 0; i < length; i ++ ) {

				array[ i ] = listenerArray[ i ];

			}

			for ( i = 0; i < length; i ++ ) {

				array[ i ].call( this, event );

			}

		}

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.dispose ()

  • description and source-code
    dispose = function () {

		this.dispatchEvent( { type: 'dispose' } );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.hasEventListener ( type, listener )

  • description and source-code
    hasEventListener = function ( type, listener ) {

		if ( this._listeners === undefined ) return false;

		var listeners = this._listeners;

		if ( listeners[ type ] !== undefined && listeners[ type ].indexOf( listener ) !== - 1 ) {

			return true;

		}

		return false;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.removeEventListener ( type, listener )

  • description and source-code
    removeEventListener = function ( type, listener ) {

		if ( this._listeners === undefined ) return;

		var listeners = this._listeners;
		var listenerArray = listeners[ type ];

		if ( listenerArray !== undefined ) {

			var index = listenerArray.indexOf( listener );

			if ( index !== - 1 ) {

				listenerArray.splice( index, 1 );

			}

		}

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.setSize ( width, height )

  • description and source-code
    setSize = function ( width, height ) {

		if ( this.width !== width || this.height !== height ) {

			this.width = width;
			this.height = height;

			this.dispose();

		}

		this.viewport.set( 0, 0, width, height );
		this.scissor.set( 0, 0, width, height );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

    WebGLRenderTargetCube = function ( width, height, options ) {

	THREE.WebGLRenderTarget.call( this, width, height, options );

	this.activeCubeFace = 0; // PX 0, NX 1, PY 2, NY 3, PZ 4, NZ 5
	this.activeMipMapLevel = 0;

}

module three.js.WebGLRenderer

function three.js.WebGLRenderer ( parameters )

  • description and source-code
    WebGLRenderer = function ( parameters ) {

	console.log( 'THREE.WebGLRenderer', THREE.REVISION );

	parameters = parameters || {};

	var _canvas = parameters.canvas !== undefined ? parameters.canvas : document.createElement( 'canvas' ),
	_context = parameters.context !== undefined ? parameters.context : null,

	_alpha = parameters.alpha !== undefined ? parameters.alpha : false,
	_depth = parameters.depth !== undefined ? parameters.depth : true,
	_stencil = parameters.stencil !== undefined ? parameters.stencil : true,
	_antialias = parameters.antialias !== undefined ? parameters.antialias : false,
	_premultipliedAlpha = parameters.premultipliedAlpha !== undefined ? parameters.premultipliedAlpha : true,
	_preserveDrawingBuffer = parameters.preserveDrawingBuffer !== undefined ? parameters.preserveDrawingBuffer : false;

	var lights = [];

	var opaqueObjects = [];
	var opaqueObjectsLastIndex = - 1;
	var transparentObjects = [];
	var transparentObjectsLastIndex = - 1;

	var morphInfluences = new Float32Array( 8 );

	var sprites = [];
	var lensFlares = [];

	// public properties

	this.domElement = _canvas;
	this.context = null;

	// clearing

	this.autoClear = true;
	this.autoClearColor = true;
	this.autoClearDepth = true;
	this.autoClearStencil = true;

	// scene graph

	this.sortObjects = true;

	// user-defined clipping

	this.clippingPlanes = [];
	this.localClippingEnabled = false;

	// physically based shading

	this.gammaFactor = 2.0;	// for backwards compatibility
	this.gammaInput = false;
	this.gammaOutput = false;

	// physical lights

	this.physicallyCorrectLights = false;

	// tone mapping

	this.toneMapping = THREE.LinearToneMapping;
	this.toneMappingExposure = 1.0;
	this.toneMappingWhitePoint = 1.0;

	// morphs

	this.maxMorphTargets = 8;
	this.maxMorphNormals = 4;

	// flags

	this.autoScaleCubemaps = true;

	// internal properties

	var _this = this,

	// internal state cache

	_currentProgram = null,
	_currentRenderTarget = null,
	_currentFramebuffer = null,
	_currentMaterialId = - 1,
	_currentGeometryProgram = '',
	_currentCamera = null,

	_currentScissor = new THREE.Vector4(),
	_currentScissorTest = null,

	_currentViewport = new THREE.Vector4(),

	//

	_usedTextureUnits = 0,

	//

	_clearColor = new THREE.Color( 0x000000 ),
	_clearAlpha = 0,

	_width = _canvas.width,
	_height = _canvas.height,

	_pixelRatio = 1,

	_scissor = new THREE.Vector4( 0, 0, _width, _height ),
	_scissorTest = false,

	_viewport = new THREE.Vector4( 0, 0, _width, _height ),

	// frustum

	_frustum = new THREE.Frustum(),

	// clipping

	_clipping = new THREE.WebGLClipping(),
	_clippingEnabled = false,
	_localClippingEnabled = false,

	_sphere = new THREE.Sphere(),

	// camera matrices cache

	_projScreenMatrix = new THREE.Matrix4(),

	_vector3 = new THREE.Vector3(),

	// light arrays cache

	_lights = {

		hash: '',

		ambient: [ 0, 0, 0 ],
		directional: [],
		directionalShadowMap: [],
		directionalShadowMatrix: [],
		spot: [],
		spotShadowMap: [],
		spotShadowMatrix: [],
		point: [],
		pointShadowMap: [],
		pointShadowMatrix: [],
		hemi: [],

		shadows: []

	},

	// info

	_infoMemory = {

		geometries: 0,
		textures: 0

	},

	_infoRender = {

		calls: 0,
		vertices: 0,
		faces: 0,
		points: 0

	};

	this.info = {

		render: _infoRender,
		memory: _infoMemory,
		programs: null

	};


	// initialize

	var _gl;

	try {

		var attributes = {
			alpha: _alpha,
			depth: _depth,
			stencil: _stencil,
			antialias: _antialias,
			premultipliedAlpha: _premultipliedAlpha,
			preserveDrawingBuffer: _preserveDrawingBuffer
		};

		_gl = _context || _canvas.getContext( 'webgl', attributes ) || _canvas.getContext( 'experimental-webgl', attributes );

		if ( _gl === null ) {

			if ( _canvas.getContext( 'webgl' ) !== null ) {

				throw 'Error creating WebGL context with your selected attributes.';

			} else {

				throw 'Error creating WebGL context.';

			} ...
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.js.WebGLUniforms

function three.js.WebGLUniforms ( gl, program, renderer )

  • description and source-code
    function WebGLUniforms( gl, program, renderer ) {

			UniformContainer.call( this );

			this.renderer = renderer;

			var n = gl.getProgramParameter( program, gl.ACTIVE_UNIFORMS );

			for ( var i = 0; i !== n; ++ i ) {

				var info = gl.getActiveUniform( program, i ),
					path = info.name,
					addr = gl.getUniformLocation( program, path );

				parseUniform( info, addr, this );

			}

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.WebGLUniforms.evalDynamic ( seq, values, object, camera )

  • description and source-code
    evalDynamic = function ( seq, values, object, camera ) {

		for ( var i = 0, n = seq.length; i !== n; ++ i ) {

			var v = values[ seq[ i ].id ],
				f = v.onUpdateCallback;

			if ( f !== undefined ) f.call( v, object, camera );

		}

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.WebGLUniforms.seqWithValue ( seq, values )

  • description and source-code
    seqWithValue = function ( seq, values ) {

		var r = [];

		for ( var i = 0, n = seq.length; i !== n; ++ i ) {

			var u = seq[ i ];
			if ( u.id in values ) r.push( u );

		}

		return r;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.WebGLUniforms.splitDynamic ( seq, values )

  • description and source-code
    splitDynamic = function ( seq, values ) {

		var r = null,
			n = seq.length,
			w = 0;

		for ( var i = 0; i !== n; ++ i ) {

			var u = seq[ i ],
				v = values[ u.id ];

			if ( v && v.dynamic === true ) {

				if ( r === null ) r = [];
				r.push( u );

			} else {

				// in-place compact 'seq', removing the matches
				if ( w < i ) seq[ w ] = u;
				++ w;

			}

		}

		if ( w < n ) seq.length = w;

		return r;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.WebGLUniforms.upload ( gl, seq, values, renderer )

  • description and source-code
    upload = function ( gl, seq, values, renderer ) {

		for ( var i = 0, n = seq.length; i !== n; ++ i ) {

			var u = seq[ i ],
				v = values[ u.id ];

			if ( v.needsUpdate !== false ) {
				// note: always updating when .needsUpdate is undefined

				u.setValue( gl, v.value, renderer );

			}

		}

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.js.WebGLUniforms.prototype

function three.js.WebGLUniforms.prototype.set ( gl, object, name )

  • description and source-code
    set = function ( gl, object, name ) {

		var u = this.map[ name ];

		if ( u !== undefined ) u.setValue( gl, object[ name ], this.renderer );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

  • description and source-code
    setOptional = function ( gl, object, name ) {

		var v = object[ name ];

		if ( v !== undefined ) this.setValue( gl, name, v );

	}
  • example usage

		var u = this.map[ name ];

		if ( u !== undefined ) u.setValue( gl, value, this.renderer );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.js.WireframeGeometry

function three.js.WireframeGeometry ( geometry )

  • description and source-code
    WireframeGeometry = function ( geometry ) {

	THREE.BufferGeometry.call( this );

	var edge = [ 0, 0 ], hash = {};

	function sortFunction( a, b ) {

		return a - b;

	}

	var keys = [ 'a', 'b', 'c' ];

	if ( geometry instanceof THREE.Geometry ) {

		var vertices = geometry.vertices;
		var faces = geometry.faces;
		var numEdges = 0;

		// allocate maximal size
		var edges = new Uint32Array( 6 * faces.length );

		for ( var i = 0, l = faces.length; i < l; i ++ ) {

			var face = faces[ i ];

			for ( var j = 0; j < 3; j ++ ) {

				edge[ 0 ] = face[ keys[ j ] ];
				edge[ 1 ] = face[ keys[ ( j + 1 ) % 3 ] ];
				edge.sort( sortFunction );

				var key = edge.toString();

				if ( hash[ key ] === undefined ) {

					edges[ 2 * numEdges ] = edge[ 0 ];
					edges[ 2 * numEdges + 1 ] = edge[ 1 ];
					hash[ key ] = true;
					numEdges ++;

				}

			}

		}

		var coords = new Float32Array( numEdges * 2 * 3 );

		for ( var i = 0, l = numEdges; i < l; i ++ ) {

			for ( var j = 0; j < 2; j ++ ) {

				var vertex = vertices[ edges [ 2 * i + j ] ];

				var index = 6 * i + 3 * j;
				coords[ index + 0 ] = vertex.x;
				coords[ index + 1 ] = vertex.y;
				coords[ index + 2 ] = vertex.z;

			}

		}

		this.addAttribute( 'position', new THREE.BufferAttribute( coords, 3 ) );

	} else if ( geometry instanceof THREE.BufferGeometry ) {

		if ( geometry.index !== null ) {

			// Indexed BufferGeometry

			var indices = geometry.index.array;
			var vertices = geometry.attributes.position;
			var groups = geometry.groups;
			var numEdges = 0;

			if ( groups.length === 0 ) {

				geometry.addGroup( 0, indices.length );

			}

			// allocate maximal size
			var edges = new Uint32Array( 2 * indices.length );

			for ( var o = 0, ol = groups.length; o < ol; ++ o ) {

				var group = groups[ o ];

				var start = group.start;
				var count = group.count;

				for ( var i = start, il = start + count; i < il; i += 3 ) {

					for ( var j = 0; j < 3; j ++ ) {

						edge[ 0 ] = indices[ i + j ];
						edge[ 1 ] = indices[ i + ( j + 1 ) % 3 ];
						edge.sort( sortFunction );

						var key = edge.toString();

						if ( hash[ key ] === undefined ) {

							edges[ 2 * numEdges ] = edge[ 0 ];
							edges[ 2 * numEdges + 1 ] = edge[ 1 ];
							hash[ key ] = true;
							numEdges ++;

						}

					}

				}

			}

			var coords = new Float32Array( numEdges * 2 * 3 );

			for ( var i = 0, l = numEdges; i < l; i ++ ) {

				for ( var j = 0; j < 2; j ++ ) {

					var index = 6 * i + 3 * j;
					var index2 = edges[ 2 * i + j ];

					coords[ index + 0 ] = vertices.getX( index2 );
					coords[ index + 1 ] = vertices.getY( index2 );
					coords[ index + 2 ] = vertices.getZ( index2 );

				}

			}

			this.addAttribute( 'position', new THREE.BufferAttribute( coords, 3 ) );

		} else {

			// non-indexed BufferGeometry

			var vertices = geometry.attributes.position.array;
			var numEdges = vertices.length / 3;
			var numTris = numEdges / 3;

			var coords = new Float32Array( numEdges * 2 * 3 );

			for ( var i = 0, l = numTris; i < l; i ++ ) {

				for ( var j = 0; j < 3; j ++ ) {

					var index = 18 * i + 6 * j;

					var index1 = 9 * i + 3 * j;
					coords[ index + 0 ] = vertices[ index1 ];
					coords[ index + 1 ] = vertices[ index1 + 1 ];
					coords[ index + 2 ] = vertices[ index1 + 2 ];

					var index2 = 9 * i + 3 * ( ( j + 1 ) % 3 );
					coords[ index + 3 ] = vertices[ index2 ];
					coords[ index + 4 ] = vertices[ index2 + 1 ];
					coords[ index + 5 ] = vertices[ index2 + 2 ];

				}

			}

			this.addAttribute( 'position', new THREE.BufferAttribute( coords, 3 ) );

		}

	}

}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.js.WireframeGeometry.prototype

function three.js.WireframeGeometry.prototype.constructor ( geometry )

  • description and source-code
    constructor = function ( geometry ) {

	THREE.BufferGeometry.call( this );

	var edge = [ 0, 0 ], hash = {};

	function sortFunction( a, b ) {

		return a - b;

	}

	var keys = [ 'a', 'b', 'c' ];

	if ( geometry instanceof THREE.Geometry ) {

		var vertices = geometry.vertices;
		var faces = geometry.faces;
		var numEdges = 0;

		// allocate maximal size
		var edges = new Uint32Array( 6 * faces.length );

		for ( var i = 0, l = faces.length; i < l; i ++ ) {

			var face = faces[ i ];

			for ( var j = 0; j < 3; j ++ ) {

				edge[ 0 ] = face[ keys[ j ] ];
				edge[ 1 ] = face[ keys[ ( j + 1 ) % 3 ] ];
				edge.sort( sortFunction );

				var key = edge.toString();

				if ( hash[ key ] === undefined ) {

					edges[ 2 * numEdges ] = edge[ 0 ];
					edges[ 2 * numEdges + 1 ] = edge[ 1 ];
					hash[ key ] = true;
					numEdges ++;

				}

			}

		}

		var coords = new Float32Array( numEdges * 2 * 3 );

		for ( var i = 0, l = numEdges; i < l; i ++ ) {

			for ( var j = 0; j < 2; j ++ ) {

				var vertex = vertices[ edges [ 2 * i + j ] ];

				var index = 6 * i + 3 * j;
				coords[ index + 0 ] = vertex.x;
				coords[ index + 1 ] = vertex.y;
				coords[ index + 2 ] = vertex.z;

			}

		}

		this.addAttribute( 'position', new THREE.BufferAttribute( coords, 3 ) );

	} else if ( geometry instanceof THREE.BufferGeometry ) {

		if ( geometry.index !== null ) {

			// Indexed BufferGeometry

			var indices = geometry.index.array;
			var vertices = geometry.attributes.position;
			var groups = geometry.groups;
			var numEdges = 0;

			if ( groups.length === 0 ) {

				geometry.addGroup( 0, indices.length );

			}

			// allocate maximal size
			var edges = new Uint32Array( 2 * indices.length );

			for ( var o = 0, ol = groups.length; o < ol; ++ o ) {

				var group = groups[ o ];

				var start = group.start;
				var count = group.count;

				for ( var i = start, il = start + count; i < il; i += 3 ) {

					for ( var j = 0; j < 3; j ++ ) {

						edge[ 0 ] = indices[ i + j ];
						edge[ 1 ] = indices[ i + ( j + 1 ) % 3 ];
						edge.sort( sortFunction );

						var key = edge.toString();

						if ( hash[ key ] === undefined ) {

							edges[ 2 * numEdges ] = edge[ 0 ];
							edges[ 2 * numEdges + 1 ] = edge[ 1 ];
							hash[ key ] = true;
							numEdges ++;

						}

					}

				}

			}

			var coords = new Float32Array( numEdges * 2 * 3 );

			for ( var i = 0, l = numEdges; i < l; i ++ ) {

				for ( var j = 0; j < 2; j ++ ) {

					var index = 6 * i + 3 * j;
					var index2 = edges[ 2 * i + j ];

					coords[ index + 0 ] = vertices.getX( index2 );
					coords[ index + 1 ] = vertices.getY( index2 );
					coords[ index + 2 ] = vertices.getZ( index2 );

				}

			}

			this.addAttribute( 'position', new THREE.BufferAttribute( coords, 3 ) );

		} else {

			// non-indexed BufferGeometry

			var vertices = geometry.attributes.position.array;
			var numEdges = vertices.length / 3;
			var numTris = numEdges / 3;

			var coords = new Float32Array( numEdges * 2 * 3 );

			for ( var i = 0, l = numTris; i < l; i ++ ) {

				for ( var j = 0; j < 3; j ++ ) {

					var index = 18 * i + 6 * j;

					var index1 = 9 * i + 3 * j;
					coords[ index + 0 ] = vertices[ index1 ];
					coords[ index + 1 ] = vertices[ index1 + 1 ];
					coords[ index + 2 ] = vertices[ index1 + 2 ];

					var index2 = 9 * i + 3 * ( ( j + 1 ) % 3 );
					coords[ index + 3 ] = vertices[ index2 ];
					coords[ index + 4 ] = vertices[ index2 + 1 ];
					coords[ index + 5 ] = vertices[ index2 + 2 ];

				}

			}

			this.addAttribute( 'position', new THREE.BufferAttribute( coords, 3 ) );

		}

	}

}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.js.WireframeHelper

function three.js.WireframeHelper ( object, hex )

  • description and source-code
    WireframeHelper = function ( object, hex ) {

	var color = ( hex !== undefined ) ? hex : 0xffffff;

	THREE.LineSegments.call( this, new THREE.WireframeGeometry( object.geometry ), new THREE.LineBasicMaterial( { color: color } ) );

	this.matrix = object.matrixWorld;
	this.matrixAutoUpdate = false;

}
  • example usage
    n/a

  • description and source-code

	var color = ( hex !== undefined ) ? hex : 0xffffff;

	THREE.LineSegments.call( this, new THREE.WireframeGeometry( object.geometry ), new THREE.LineBasicMaterial( { color: color } ) );

	this.matrix = object.matrixWorld;
	this.matrixAutoUpdate = false;

}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.js.XHRLoader

    XHRLoader = function ( manager ) {

	this.manager = ( manager !== undefined ) ? manager : THREE.DefaultLoadingManager;

}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.js.XHRLoader.prototype

function three.js.XHRLoader.prototype.constructor ( manager )

  • description and source-code
    constructor = function ( manager ) {

	this.manager = ( manager !== undefined ) ? manager : THREE.DefaultLoadingManager;

}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.XHRLoader.prototype.load ( url, onLoad, onProgress, onError )

  • description and source-code
    load = function ( url, onLoad, onProgress, onError ) {

		if ( this.path !== undefined ) url = this.path + url;

		var scope = this;

		var cached = THREE.Cache.get( url );

		if ( cached !== undefined ) {

			if ( onLoad ) {

				setTimeout( function () {

					onLoad( cached );

				}, 0 );

			}

			return cached;

		}

		var request = new XMLHttpRequest();
		request.overrideMimeType( 'text/plain' );
		request.open( 'GET', url, true );

		request.addEventListener( 'load', function ( event ) {

			var response = event.target.response;

			THREE.Cache.add( url, response );

			if ( this.status === 200 ) {

				if ( onLoad ) onLoad( response );

				scope.manager.itemEnd( url );

			} else if ( this.status === 0 ) {

				// Some browsers return HTTP Status 0 when using non-http protocol
				// e.g. 'file://' or 'data://'. Handle as success.

				console.warn( 'THREE.XHRLoader: HTTP Status 0 received.' );

				if ( onLoad ) onLoad( response );

				scope.manager.itemEnd( url );

			} else {

				if ( onError ) onError( event );

				scope.manager.itemError( url );

			}

		}, false );

		if ( onProgress !== undefined ) {

			request.addEventListener( 'progress', function ( event ) {

				onProgress( event );

			}, false );

		}

		request.addEventListener( 'error', function ( event ) {

			if ( onError ) onError( event );

			scope.manager.itemError( url );

		}, false );

		if ( this.responseType !== undefined ) request.responseType = this.responseType;
		if ( this.withCredentials !== undefined ) request.withCredentials = this.withCredentials;

		request.send( null );

		scope.manager.itemStart( url );

		return request;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.js.XHRLoader.prototype.setPath ( value )

  • description and source-code
    setPath = function ( value ) {

		this.path = value;

	}
  • example usage
